title: When are we going to have Supports based on debuffs?
body:
why the entire support class is CC supports, enchanter supports?

how about you start to make fun to play supports that can debuff the enemy team? 
support {{champion:48}} who got olafed for some reasons was a PERFECT one.

i think the closest thing to a debuff support we have is support {{champion:14}} who can reduces the armor of a single/multiple target(s) by 20%, but you guessed that he's more around cc'ing the enemy team.

sweet, how about an attack speed debuff? 
Rip support {{champion:20}} 2012
AOE high armor debuff for an AD comp?
Rip support {{champion:44}} 2012


damage amplification? linked target that takes a % of damage if the other takes damage? Please stop doing generic supports with protection/bonus AD or AS/CC.

Edit: i see some people talking about {{champion:6}} , Riot might makes him a debuff supports with his rework.

replies.body: Because most people find it funner to be buffed up than be debuffed down. I don´t know to be honest. Illaoi is the closest you´ll find to that right now with her E.

If we go into "buffing up" too much we will end up with a game of one shots. I do not see how one would find that more fun than just being debuffed... also CC always existed, would ppl like getting CC locked for 4 seconds by full Leona combo more than dealing less damage for next 4 seconds? I doubt it... especially that debuffs have counterplay of waiting them out. *COUGH* {{item:3123}} *COUGH*

Champions that debuff other champions (e.g. nunu) are ridiculously boring to play as and against. They basically make the game a 4v4, since they do nothing except eliminate one other champion from the game.

That would only be if the debuffs were single target, and even then you could distribute them to whoever will be most affected by them.

Nunu is a terrible example because other than his ult (which is easily interrupted), his only debuff is single targeted.

If the champion had various debuffs or the debuffs were ground targeted (like tormented soil), that would provide far more unique and interesting play.  In fact I think it would be very interesting for a support to be able to place zones of weakness, giving a support with serious zoning potential without being raw damage.

Because debuffs make things onesided most of the time.

Grev wounds vs a healing champ for instance.

That's great, you can deal with that mundo now, but now Mundo feels like he's even more useless than he was before. 

It's not fun to have your stuff stolen
The counterpoint to that is that you can also have your defensive stats buffed up as well, though for some reason that doesn't seem to be as common.

If all damage in game was let's say increased by 20% and to counter the "one-shot" factor all defs were buffed by 20% then there was no point in any buffs at all since both damage and defense increase cancel each other.

Yeah, that idea is what I was getting at. Increasing the power of buff up abilities won't necessarily lead to the game becoming focused on one-shotting people because defensive buffs like shields and armor/MR increases will be buffed too.

Riot would probably say something about 'hidden power' and how it's hard to notice it's impact, but I can definitely see it working at some point. Perhaps an anti-healing support, who could constantly apply Healing reduction as a counter to something like {{champion:16}} {{champion:37}} or {{champion:8}} .
Have you heard about Grevious Wounds...
They also don't want champions' kits to revolve around countering specific other champions' kits.
They had a chance to remove Katarina's GW from her ult during rework, they did not. Why on earth does she even still have GW there, it has no sense on bursty assassin...
Probably because no one cares. I honestly think that if they took the GW off {{item:3165}} no one would ever notice.
Quite possibly. It's weird that it used to be a situational buy, but then they changed Athene's so that Morello's had to become the standard. So pretty much all mages have GW now.
GW is huge against certain champions.  It really would probably be for the best for them to just remove GW though and rebalance healing effects (including lifesteal).
still want blood lust and Rage spreading in the form of reworked {{champion:266}} and could be debuffs too demoralizing and fear for the enemies as his lore blatantly says he should
Only if that's an after effect of a reworked top Aatrox, I'm down for niche support Aatrox.
There's huge balancing issues with debuff champs since debuffing an enemy is like buffing every single person on your team, while buffs only affect 1 person on your team.

What kind of logic is that?
With that line of reasoning, you could say that a buff on one ally is a debuff to EVERY SINGLE PERSON on the enemy team vs that target. Wow so broken.

And a debuff on one enemy would be a buff to all allies vs only that target. It wouldn't affect the rest of their team, and it wouldn't affect your teammates that aren't interacting with them....
Isn't this exactly what I've been making these long-winded posts for? TO DO ANYTHING BESIDES THE SAME THING ON ALMOST EVERY SUPPORT CHAMP IN THE GAME?

Urgot with executioners shuts down healing very well.

Ya know what. Who else thinks Urgot just needs his shield to auto apply to the nearest ally and he can support?

LOL

do this, fucking do this please. but then riot and the community will tell you that urgot is "toxic" and needs to be trash

>but then riot and the community will tell you that urgot is "toxic" and needs to be trash

With those award winning good looks? Will never happen. Urgod makes even Taric look good. ;p
Sona W powerchord?

diminueno is extremely situational, you only apply it once a while and only need to apply it at a good moment because it lasts 2 seconds. If Lucian dashes on you and does his combo you need to have your 3 stacks ready because if you apply the damage reduction after his E+AA+Q+AA you already lost a lot of hp and it's worthless.
And yes, Sona's kit doesn't revolve about it.

Then you have Trundle who can removes a lot of AD for a lot of seconds, and his R removes armor/mr for like 6 seconds.

{{champion:48}} kit is around debuffs. And we need more champs like this
Play Urgot if you want debuffs.
honestly Urgot would have been a god support if the champ wasn't trash
Urgot support would be stupid strong if he had any peel in his base kit, as it is, peeling only once every 60 seconds with ult isn't exactly good.
i mean he has a strong permaslow on W.

Why does Rito hate silences so much?  IMO silences are healthier than stuns on everything. Meanwhile in Dota2 you can get silenced for about 10 seconds, and a guy who's all about silencing. I don't know how they balance dota insanity, but they do somehow. Most league players would get tilted into the next patch if that was in league...

I would love a support built around marking enemies for damage amplification.

but a support that does lame stuff like reduce damage seems kinda pointless when cc monsters like nami and leona exist who can outright hard stun you

What about supports that play with vision and invisibility? Nearsighting someone is definitely a debuff, and it would be cool IMO for Riot to emphasize vision abilities in the support class like how we have several marksman with some powerful ways of getting vision. 

{{champion:22}} {{champion:429}} {{champion:133}}

When I imagine a debuffer champion, I think of a champion who has the ability to exhaust an enemy constantly. 

People say it wouldn't be noticeable but being exhausted is extremely noticeable.

Most of the time debuffs in PvP don't provide much counterplay.

There's a reason auras are getting gutted OR becoming much more temporary.

You can't just randomly throw PvE elements and think they are going to be a healthy mechanic in PvP, it doesn't work that way.

The point is that we have too many supports forced into doing the same thing over and over again. It's something I've been trying to make a discussion point, but to no avail.

Regardless, when *every support is forced to play like Janna*, you either like that reactive, defensive play...or you don't play support. Hell, even Lulu goes E -> W -> Q nowadays.
Every support plays like Janna?

or braum
some are a mixt of both

Trundle support is like neither of them

{{champion:89}} {{champion:63}} {{champion:143}} {{champion:412}} {{champion:53}} ...the list goes on and on.  None of these champs are much like Braum or Janna, and certainly are not a mixture of the two.

It isn't about kits. It's about the game forcing a specific meta in the support role, which is extremely reactive and defensive, through itemization choices and the community's own negative stigmas against offensive supports like Zyra and Brand.

Negative stigma?  Rofl...who cares about that?  Offensive supports are well known to be a perfectly viable option.  And really the only stigma is from whiny ADCs who don't like the support getting any kills.

Have you seen the boards? EVERYONE puts the term "support" in quotations when referencing someone like Lux/Zyra/Brand/Vel/so on. People don't respect that play style, and that mindset is doubled down by the fact that itemization ALSO doesn't support that play style.
Not to a tee, but most enchanters are forced to play with her mindset.
Not seeing it.  Sona looks to poke and heal.  Soraka just endlessly heals.  Lulu buffs and debuffs while she pokes.  Janna is pretty much a pure counter-engage enchanter.  She's fairly unique.

Sona is made to poke, shield, and heal, right?

What does she BUILD if we limit her build to support items? Outside of Ardent Censor, nothing that helps *poke*, just her heal. Sona takes Watchers and Ardent, and after that it's nothing with a lick of ap on it unless she branches off into mid laner items. You're talking about kits. I'm talking about builds emphasizing a specific play pattern. These are two different things.

Like, let's look at Lulu, right? She also is a hybrid between poke/heal/shield, right? Her E -> W -> Q path is now her strongest winning path. Sona would probably be the same way if her W wasn't so expensive per cost on top of her low starting mana. The whole role is being forced into either playing like Janna or playing like Braum, depending on if you're an enchanter or a warden.
Would be extremely toxic to play against them I guess.
And ??? there many champion toxic already.
I'd love to see a Witch Doctoresque support in this game.

I love this idea, I think debuffing would be much more fun than champions with heals/shields/attack speed buffs.  A kind of warlock support that decreases enemy damage with one ability would be cool, and things of that sort.

Stat debuffs tend to be really really annoying to balance, as entire kits are based around having stats to compensate and such. That's why we don't have many debuffs that go beyond armor/MR/MS. This is why urgot isn't ever allowed to be viable, as his passive, which im pretty sure is just a damage reduction debuff, tends to do STUPID amounts of work.

Also you know items like  {{item:3046}}  tend to set an incredibly poor example.

isn't this why there was a phase that {{champion:23}}  was taken bot? maxing shout and cutting the enemy AD by a fuck ton in aoe from range?
very very annoying to challange
